title: Bootstrapping a SaaS While Working Full-Time
author: John Doe
content: I started building my SaaS while working a 9-5 job. I could only dedicate about 10 hours a week. It took me 8 months to launch the MVP. The key was picking a narrow niche and building only core features first.

title: How I Launched an App in 12 Weeks
author: Jane Smith
content: As a full-time college student, I carved out 20 hours a week for my side project. I used weekends to do the heavy lifting. MVP was ready in 12 weeks, and I got my first paying users by week 14.

title: Solo Founder Journey: From Idea to $1k MRR
author: Sahil Patel
content: Started with just 5 hours/week due to family and consulting work. MVP took 6 months. I grew slowly but consistently, reaching $1,000 MRR after 9 months. IndieHackers community helped a lot.

title: Quit My Job, Built MVP in 1 Month
author: Lena Morris
content: I quit my job and went full-time. Worked ~60 hrs/week. My MVP took just 4 weeks. Launched on Product Hunt in week 5 and gained 500 users by week 6. High focus helped speed things up.

title: Building a Marketplace While Parenting
author: Alex Green
content: With 2 kids and a part-time job, I could commit ~12 hrs/week. It took me 10 months to build and launch a working version. The timeline stretched because I was learning as I went.
